sen.j: 中村福助（なかむら ふくすけ）は中村歌右衛門系統の歌舞伎の名跡の一。
sen.e: Fukusuke NAKAMURA is a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) of Utaemon NAKAMURA line.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA is a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) of Utaemon NAKAMURA line.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA is a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) of Utaemon NAKAMURA line.

sen.j: 歌右衛門又は芝翫の前名とすることが多いが、現在では児太郎、福助、芝翫、歌右衛門の順が一般的。
sen.e: Many cases it is viewed as a previous name of Utaemon or Shikan but presently, it is common to have an order of Kotaro, Fukusuke, Shikan and then Utaemon.
The name, Fukusuke, is often used as a previous name of Utaemon or Shikan: the common order of names these days is Kotaro, Fukusuke, Shikan and then Utaemon.

A person with the stage name of Fukusuke would often take the name Utaemon or Shikan when he made his full debut; nowadays, however, the most common names to be adopted by a person with the stage name of Fukusuke are Kotaro, Fukusuke, Shikan and Utaemon, in that order.

sen.j: 屋号「成駒屋」。
sen.e: Stage family name is 'Narikomaya'.
Stage family name is 'Narikomaya'.
Stage family name is 'Narikomaya'.

sen.j: 紋は祇園守。
sen.e: Family crest is gionmori (the emblem (or family crest) of the Narikomaya Kabuki family).
Family crest is gionmori (the emblem (or family crest) of the Narikomaya Kabuki family).
Family crest is gionmori (the emblem (or family crest) of the Narikomaya Kabuki family).

sen.j: （後述する大阪福助の場合は、梅玉の前名。屋号高砂屋。)
sen.e: (As for Osaka Fukusuke described later, it is a previous name of Baigyoku.
(Osaka Fukusuke described later is a previous name of Baigyoku. Family crest is Takasagoya.)
sen.cmt: 表現シンプル化（）内なので後列の部分もここにまとめました。
sen.e: (Osaka Fukusuke described later is a previous name of Baigyoku. Family crest is Takasagoya.)

sen.j: もとは三代目歌右衛門の幼名福之助からとった何ということのない名跡のひとつであった。
sen.e: Originally it was one of plain professional name taken from a childhood name of Utaemon the third, Fukunosuke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Originally it was one of plain professional names taken from a childhood name of Utaemon the third, Fukunosuke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ＯＫname →names
sen.e: Originally it was one of plain professional names taken from a childhood name of Utaemon the third, Fukunosuke.

sen.j: しかし、二代目が大阪で客死したのち、当地の興行師が窮余の一策として若手俳優に勝手に三代目を名乗らせた。
sen.e: However the second died abroad in Osaka and promoter of the location arbitrarily made a young actor to clam the third, as one of desperate measure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However Utaemon the second died abroad in Osaka and a promoter there arbitrarily made a young actor clam the third, as one of desperate measure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処OK
sen.e: However, when Utaemon the second died in Osaka, a promoter there arbitrarily decided to make a young actor adopt the name of Utaemon the third, as a last resort.

sen.j: そのために、以降東西二系統の「福助」が並立し、因縁つきの名跡となる。
sen.e: Because of that, 'Fukusuke' of 2 lines, east and west, came to stand abreast thereafter, and became a professional name with a history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, 'Fukusuke' of two lines, east and west, came to stand abreast thereafter, and became a professional name with a pretext.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処OK
sen.e: Since then, the two lines of Fukusuke have coexisted, one in the east and one in the west, and the name has become a topic of considerable debate.

sen.j: 通常は大阪系統を「高砂屋福助」もしくは「大阪福助」などと称する。
sen.e: Normally, line of Osaka is called 'Takasagoya Fukusuke' or 'Osaka Fukusuke'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Normally, line of Osaka is called 'Takasagoya Fukusuke' or 'Osaka Fukusuke'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ＯＫ
sen.e: Normally, line of Osaka is called 'Takasagoya Fukusuke' or 'Osaka Fukusuke'.

sen.j: しかし、名跡が分裂したことに怒った五代目歌右衛門（4代目福助）が、東京系（成駒屋系統）の正統性を主張するため「福助の名跡は一瞬たりとも空白にすべからず」と遺言した。
sen.e: However, Utaemon the fifth (Fukusuke the fourth) enraged at the fact that the professional name was split, he willed 'professional name of Fukusuke must not be left blank for any moment' to claim legitimacy of line of Tokyo (line of Narikomaya).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Utaemon the fifth (Fukusuke the fourth) enraged at the fact that the professional name was split, he willed 'professional name of Fukusuke must not be left blank for any moment' to claim legitimacy of line of Tokyo (line of Narikomaya).

However, Utaemon the fifth (Fukusuke the fourth) enraged at the fact that the professional name was split, he willed 'professional name of Fukusuke must not be left blank for any moment' to claim legitimacy of line of Tokyo (line of Narikomaya).

sen.j: このために、他の名跡に比べて代数が異常に多いのが特色である。
sen.e: Because of this, the professional name has a characteristic of unusually many generations compared with other professional name.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because of this, the professional name has a characteristic of unusually many generations compared with other professional name.
Because of this, the professional name has a characteristic of unusually many generations compared with other professional name.

sen.j: 高砂屋福助の系統は五代目福助没後家系が途絶え、六代目歌右衛門がみずからの長男に四代目梅玉を継がせたため、現在では実質的に高砂屋福助の名跡は消滅している。
sen.e: For line of Takasagoya Fukusuke, family lineage ceased after Fukusuke the fifth died, and Utaemon the sixth made his eldest son to carry Baigyoku the fourth, therefore the professional name of Takasagoya Fukusuke has practically disappeared.

For line of Takasagoya Fukusuke, family lineage ceased after Fukusuke the fifth died, and Utaemon the sixth made his eldest son carry Baigyoku the fourth, therefore the professional name of Takasagoya Fukusuke has practically disappeared.

For line of Takasagoya Fukusuke, family lineage ceased after Fukusuke the fifth died, and Utaemon the sixth made his eldest son carry Baigyoku the fourth, therefore the professional name of Takasagoya Fukusuke has practically disappeared.

sen.j: 初代中村福助 中村歌右衛門 (4代目)の養子。
sen.e: Fukusuke NAKAMURA the first was an adopted son of Utaemon NAKAMURA (the fourth).
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the first was an adopted son of Utaemon NAKAMURA (the fourth).
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the first was an adopted son of Utaemon NAKAMURA (the fourth).

sen.j: 後の中村芝翫 (4代目)。
sen.e: Later became Shikan NAKAMURA (the fourth).
Later became Shikan NAKAMURA (the fourth).
Later became Shikan NAKAMURA (the fourth).

sen.j: 二代目中村福助 初代の弟。
sen.e: Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second was a brother of the first.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second was a brother of the first.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second was a brother of the first.

sen.j: 大阪で夭折。
sen.e: He died young in Osaka.
He died young in Osaka.
He died young in Osaka.

sen.j: 中村福助 (2代目)の項を参照。
sen.e: See Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second for reference.
See Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second for reference.
See Fukusuke NAKAMURA the second for reference.

sen.j: このほか江戸時代に歌右衛門の門弟で中村福助を名乗った役者がいるが、通常代数には数えない。
sen.e: Other that, there was a disciple of Utaemon who claimed Fukusuke NAKAMURA in Edo era, but normally is not counted as a generation.
Other that, there was a disciple of Utaemon who claimed Fukusuke NAKAMURA in Edo era, but normally is not counted as a generation.
Other that, there was a disciple of Utaemon who claimed Fukusuke NAKAMURA in Edo era, but normally is not counted as a generation.

sen.j: 三代目中村福助 門弟が一時期継いだが後に改名。
sen.e: Fukusuke NAKAMURA the third was succeeded to a disciple once, but the name was changed later.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the third was succeeded to a disciple once, but the name was changed later.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the third was succeeded to a disciple once, but the name was changed later.

sen.j: 四代目中村福助 初代の養子。
sen.e: Fukusuke NAKAMURA the fourth was an adopted son of the first.
Fukusuke NAKAMURA the fourth was an adopted son of the first.

sen.j: 後の中村歌右衛門 (5代目)。
sen.e: Later became Utaemon NAKAMURA (the fifth).

sen.j: 「慶ちゃん福助」の愛称で親しまれた。
sen.e: He was popularly known as 'Kei chan Fukusuke'.
He was popularly known as 'Kei chan Fukusuke'.

sen.j: 妻有紀子は作家武者小路実篤の孫娘。
sen.e: His wife, Yukiko, was a granddaughter of Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI, a novelist.
